alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:59PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Marshall, northern Benton, southeastern Fayette and southern Hardeman Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 259 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whiteville to Byhalia. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holly Springs, Bolivar, Lamar, Whiteville, Byhalia, Snow Lake Shores, Canaan, Mt Pleasant, Lagrange, Michigan City, Red Banks, Slayden, Rossville, Moscow, Williston, Grand Junction, Hornsby, La Grange, Hickory Valley and Saulsbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
